title: Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)
description: At the most basic level, all SIEM solutions perform some level of data aggregation, consolidation and sorting functions in order to identify threats and adhere to data compliance requirements.
key-ideas: Aggregates logs, event data, and metrics into a centralized location and generates alerts by analyzing and correlating the data.
The biggest SIEM distinguishing feature is CORRELATION of events.
Provides a centralized dashboard for viewing logs, metrics, alerts, and other correlating data making it very useful for Security Operation Centers (SOCs).
Security alerts, event correlation, log management, UEBA, forensics.
May watch for insider threats, injection attacks, DoS, data loss, and indicators of compromise.
